bibl.title: Skandinaven
[Names and Locations of Norwegian Churches and Homes]
Norwegian Free Churches

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

bibl.title: Skandinaven
[Names and Locations of Norwegian Churches and Homes]
Norwegian Free Churches

body.p: Mooreland Norwegian Church, 50th Avenue and Ohio Street, Reverend K. J. Wang.
The Bethel Free Church, Central Park and Wrightwood Avenue, Reverend S. M. Andreasen.
Silo Church, 1728 Armitage Avenue, Reverend.....
The Salem Church, California and Mc Lean Avenues, Reverend C. T. Dyrnes.
Baptist Churches
Logan Square Baptist Church, Humboldt Boulevard and Wrightwood Avenue, Reverend P. Stiansen.
Bethel Baptist Church, Reverend C. C. Elving
The First Danish Baptist Church, Talman Avenue and Le Moyne Street, Reverend A. B. Hansen.
Norwegian-Danish Methodist Churches
Kedzie Avenue Norwegian-Danish Methodist Church, Kedzie Avenue and Cortland Street, Reverend T. M. Hauge.
Bethania Church, Albany Avenue and Byron Street, Reverend...
Bethel Norwegian-Danish Church, 72nd Street and Ingleside Avenue, Reverend C. Mathiesen.

Maplewood Avenue Methodist Church, Le Moyne Street and Maplewood Avenue,
Reverend O. H. Wilson.
Moreland Norwegian-Danish Methodist Church, 5130 West Ontario Street, Reverend P. Haugan.
Evanston Norwegian-Danish Nethodist Church, Clark Street and Sherman Avenue, Reverend H. P. Pergh.
First and Immanuel M. E. Church, Wrightwood and Kimball Avenues, Reverend F. J. Trelstad. The Epworth League meets every Tuesday.
Children's Homes
The Evangelical Lutheran Home-Finding Society, 1627 Byron Street, Reverend J. M. Pirkeland, president.
The Norwegian Lutheran Orphan Home, 5800 Irving Park Boulevard, Mrs. Caroline Williams, matron; Reverend N. J. Ellestad, president.
The Town Mission, affiliated with the poorhouse, insane asylum, and Pulmonary Hospital, Reverend J. N. Pirkeland.
The Hope Mission, Noble and Ohio streets, music school, monday-Friday, reading room open daily from 9 A. M. to 8 P. M. Ulrikka F. Fruun, president and superintendent.
